repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body: Attempt to fix the issue described here: https://github.com/cython/cython/pull/3640#issuecomment-656598139

comment_data.body: Is this the right place to define `__PYX_ENUM_DECL`?
It might be better in https://github.com/cython/cython/blob/master/Cython/Utility/CppSupport.cpp (and then use that chunk of utility code only if needed)
Thanks! Could you clarify what "only if needed" means here? Where would be best to use that utility code?

Ideally you call `env.use_utility_code` at the point where you decide that you need it. However, you don't have a handle to a scope inside `declaration_code`. One option would be to set `utility_code` on the entry in `Symtab.Scope.declare_enum`?

If that doesn't work easily then it may be bad advice.
Does this really apply to plain C enums as well? It seemed to me that it's only a C++ enum issue. I would like to keep the code impact of this as low as possible.
Yes, attaching the utility code section to the C++ enum entry's `.utility_code` sounds good.
Thanks both -- does what I have now seem better?
It doesn't have to, so I renamed the macro `__PYX_ENUM_CLASS_DECL` and now use it only for the declaration of C++ enums.

What you've done was pretty much what I had in mind. Is `self.use_entry_utility_code(entry)` necessary? I'd have thought setting the attribute on the entry should be enough and using the utility code should automatically happen later (but I might be wrong)
Hmm -- I tried and that doesn't work, unfortunately.

commit.message: Fix Python 3.4 + MSVC issue with elaborated type specifier for enum
Move enum class declaration utility code to CppSupport.cpp

repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

milestone.description:
Goals:
 New version scheme: 3.x instead of 0.x.
 Change default `language_level` from `2` to `3`.
 Change default for `binding` directive from `False` to `True`.
 Fix some Python compatibility issues (if possible, allowing for breaking changes).

title: Fix Python 3.4 + MSVC issue with elaborated type specifier for enum
